Tree | blank1_info_sec1 = Flowering Dogwood | blank2_name_sec1 = - Flower | blank2_info_sec1 = Japanese iris | blank3_name_sec1 = | blank3_info_sec1 = | blank4_name_sec1 = | blank4_info_sec1 = | blank5_name_sec1 = | blank5_info_sec1 = | blank6_name_sec1 = | blank6_info_sec1 = | blank7_name_sec1 = | blank7_info_sec1 = | blank_name_sec2 = Phone number | blank_info_sec2 = 0594-24-1136 | blank1_name_sec2 = Address | blank1_info_sec2 = 2-37 Chūōchō, Kuwana-shi, Mie-ken 511-8601 | website = | footnotes = }} is a Japanese city in Mie Prefecture on the island of Honshū. ==History== In the Edo period, Kuwana-juku was 42nd of the 53 shogunate-maintained waystations (shuku-eki) along the Tōkaidō road which connected Edo and Kyoto.Nussbaum, "Tōkaidō" at p. 973. ==Gallery== File:Tokaido42 Kuwana.jpg|Kuwana rest stop by Hiroshige, ukiyo-e woodblock print c. 1830s File:IshidoriMatsuri.JPG|Ishidori Matsuri, annual festival in August ==Related pages== * The Fifty-three Stations of the Tōkaidō ==References== ==Other websites== * Kuwana City website * Hiroshige prints, Kuwana Category:Cities in Mie Prefecture
title: Kuwana, Mie
